I am pretty particular about tacos because I don't like floury shells. These shells were made to perfection and so was everything else! We tried 4/5 tacos and each one was full of flavor and goodness. I enjoy going to different taco places around the city. If you do too, make sure you put Baco on your list!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vemURtk2yp_8iNsLmHJpng.text: This review is for baco. The rice was not cooked and sent out raw to me twice. The rest of the meats were great, but the rice bowl was disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The rice for Baco&#39;s taco bowl is raw.

D9bspMYI_Y6ZG9NL3Kw0_A.text: Recommend by a friend, interesting restaurant, u can order at different stalls and eat everything together, I order spicy pie and flank steak, both delicious. Very large spaces inside, so it's very easy to find place to seat.  Ps. They also provide some wonderful craft beers

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

v8Q_nC9qPxK-oWrWIpwEaw.text: Went for Sunday brunch. Multiple options to choose from from new restaurant vendors. I highly advise trying Bahn Mi. Very creative Vietnamese style of food features such as Pho and other creations that are collaboratively epicurean.   Sat at the bar which is a full bar service with craft cocktails, IPAs, local beers, and drink specials.   It's quite busy and not super loud but the voices carry.   Communal seating throughout and separate dining room area in the back. I would say that you could leave the kids at home, but there's too much good food to enjoy with them.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Toast - Bahn Mi

valt96dhICyIcdnu01fmdA.text: I have visited Smallman Galley many times, and I have loved it every time. Today was my first visit to the new concepts (which tend to rotate in June), so I was excited to try out some new food for brunch.  I ordered the Salmon Plate from Joey's Snack Bar. The plate consisted of salmon, a fresh and lightly dressed salad, a perfectly hard boiled egg with a wet yolk, and herb cream cheese spread. It arrived with bread that was reminiscent of an everything bagel. The whole bite was absolutely delicious when I spread some of the cream cheese on the "bagel", topped with salmon, a bit of the egg, and some of the salad. It was the perfect brunch dish.  I also grabbed a bloody mary from the bar. I wasn't the biggest fan of the drink because it tasted very vinegar heavy with a lot of horseradish but not a lot of other complex flavors that are present in an excellent bloody mary. Oh well, I still drank the whole thing--my palate is not that discerning.  I will definitely be stopping by Joey's again, and I can't wait to try out Home as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon Plate from Joey&#39;s

k-zk5ZCmqR32bfmw1tavhw.text: This place is really cool! I'm not sure if everyday is as busy as the day we went. We went on a Sunday and during pride month, I feel like that speaks for itself! There are multiple ways to enter. Seating is first come first serve. When you get inside, there are multiple rooms (the dinning room is the best because it's more open, it's cooler, and a lot brighter than any other room). There's a coffee bar, an actual bar, and ~6-7 places to order food. We went during brunch, so the food locations had a couple different items not on the normal menu. We got loaded fries, tater tots, Mac and cheese, lobster avocado toast, and a couple drinks. Our overall experience was good! The room with all the stoves/grills was the absolute hottest! We were dripping sweat trying to decide what to eat. There were plates, silverware, napkins, and salt/pepper in the dinning room. When you order food, they give you a number and they run the food over to you. There are water crafts and glasses on every table for you to drink. When you're done, they bus your table for the next guest! In conclusion, I suggest coming here if you're in the area! The food was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wgUB4EZyWjhNzo_m0wLyTw.text: Really cool concept. I've been to federal galley quite a few times and figured I would try this one.  A few of us went for brunch one Sunday and we had some bloody Mary's, mimosas and the breakfast pizza.  I love that you can order from any of the 4 places, bar or coffee bar. The only issue I had was that it was kind of tight for seating. At federal galley there is a lot more room and seating. I just prefer a larger area, but they made the most use out of the space.

fHpSxJdCNIaTLCFhPzrCrg.text: Pro tip: make your way to Smallman Galley - even though there's construction on Smallman until forever. It wasn't as crazy busy as it usually gets... I think in part to having to walk a little further for parking.   Anyways, I've been dying to go try the new restaurants in Smallman (Joey's Snack Bar & HOME PGH) and get some the good pizza from Iron Born.   Another pro tip: get a table first and then order what you want. It will give you the opportunity to get all the foods to try. They have 4 unique restaurants to try!   Last night, I ordered the Forager pie from Iron Born - it's amazinggg! I also ordered the weekly special Gabagool sandwich 'fresh mozzarella iron born red sauce, hot capicola, salami, and their fried chicken sandwich! It was very good!   My friend ordered the Rise & Shine fried chicken sandwich! It had sausage gravy, American cheese, a dippy egg, and maple dijonaise on it. She enjoyed it very much.   We also split HOME's TV dinner. Pulled pork, Mac & cheese, fried green tomatoes, mixed vegetables, and a biscuit. I've been dying to it and it was delicious!   HOME also let us try their Nutella cheesecake dessert in a jar. It was very good! It was something totally different than I had before.   Unfortunately, there was nothing at Joey's that I wanted to try, so I'll be back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

JU2BT9P6rRwYy78aFo8oGg.text: First restaurant that we tried in Pittsburgh. The dishes are pretty good, especially the chicken pot pie, it's a must try! The Brussels sprouts is really good as well. Just make sure to eat it when it's still hot, so that it will be crispy instead of hard. The beef is sorta chewy, too hard for me. But if you like chewy beef, order it. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken pot pie
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef &amp; potato

YrsG7lYm7y38skfWJadjcw.text: Great vibes, good food selections and a variety of them at that. There is something on the menus for everyone as well as a good tap list.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Parm Panini

w-32fNkpxO9kelwFubVCaw.text: I love this place! Great food and drinks. It's 5 resurants and a bar.   The bar is where I start. If you want a finely made handcrafted cocktail this is the place for you. I suggest the Boston Sour as it is my favorite drink to have here.  Iron born pizza should be on a best of Pittsburgh list. Deep dish pizza crunchy, chewy delicious crust. Innovative toppings and sauce options. The mushroom pie is my favorite. The main problem with Iron born is that it's soooo good it's hard to pick an offering from the other options.  The next restaurant is Colonia, with a menu of dishes from Latin America. I have had the Pupusas, stuffed corn tortillas topped with slaw. It was better than the Pupusas I've had in other restaurants. I hope to try their other options soon.  Banhmilicious is a Vietnamese restaurant that has a beautiful bone broth. I could drink it by the glass. They have pho and banh mi also.  Brunoise is a French option I have not tried but the risotto looked really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

T9NXAHjdw8El6xBY_HdGpw.text: mm mm mmmmm. Excuse me as I scarf down this entire box of pizza, as there will be absolutely no sharing. Hand Forged, and all mine.   I would like to take this opportunity to apologize to the City of Detroit in its entirety, as I previously dismissed your pizza as a gimmick, or even n imitation Chicago deep dish. I know...fighting words. But Detroit style pizza, really?! Apparently yes really! By way of Pittsburgh.   Smallman Galley has been on my radar for quite some time now. The four restaurant open concept is pretty cool if I must say. Out of the four, Hand Forged easily topped my wish list; I mean it's not often you run into this style of pizza.   The two sauce pie is perfect for undecideds like myself: half white, half red. And feeling extra fancy, I opt to add pepperoni to the red side. After one bite, I float into pizza heaven. Red sauce, oven crispified pepperoni, creamy white sauce, mounds of cheese, and fennel sausage(you can put that stuff on anything and id eat it). This is nothing like a Chicago deep dish! The chewy crust makes all the difference. And with the oven browning the edges, you get both chewy and crispy crust in one bite. Like I previously stated...pizza heaven.   Pittsburgh is legit one of the most underrated culinarily destinations in the country in my humble opinion. Never disappoints. Add Hand Forged Pizza to the list of greats. As for the other three restaurants at Smallman, as long as this pizza is within arms length, I might never get around to its neighbors...like ever.   By the way, for anyone wondering which is better, red or white? Well that's easy. The winner is....me. For having consumed both.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Pj4VGz9N20-VbqCqdojVOA.text: The previous review explained the concept.  There were three of us when we visited and we each ordered from a different spot.  They were all great.  It's a something different in the Strip.  The evening we were there was quiet and relaxing.

wUs1nr6XzScP9r8V5uFnng.text: This place is super unique. I love how you can choose between 4 different restaurants. I tried a few of the restaurants and I thought the food was good, but not fantastic. It's hard to completely judge the food since there are so many options, so I would say give it a shot. It's a really cool experience that I think anyone would enjoy.

y-4SR3JOEleblG38942AwA.text: a new favorite lunch spot.  I love all of the the choices and ever changing menus.  always very clean and never a long wait!

tMcBOz89xUrETkGuSnHoZg.text: what an awesome concept.. 4 restaurants, one building, and a great bar/beer selection to go along with it.    to describe this place as a "hipster cafeteria" maybe doing it a disservice, but you get the idea.  Highly recommend checking it out

3R4gplriphrtYk5I59BwRQ.text: A completely brilliant concept. There are so many options, and they're all fantastic. The aesthetic is cool, open and airy with options for communal or private seating. The bar has great options and the drinks are interesting. Go during happy hour to get really great drink specials.

HV1ahXKS5QUQYjYM2209MA.text: We have never been disappointed. Food is WONDERFUL at each restaurant! Creative concept, great location and good prices!

gFQaeEXIz27uvwbJ8xUz6w.text: I don't understand the hype of this place. I found the ambiance like a Fire Department Hall and the food barely above average. I have no need to return here.

cM0wMujCJGi1F9e2cAVAfg.text: This is one of the most fun and interesting restaurants in Pittsburgh.  The chefs each take such pride in their menus and the staff works hard to make sure everyone gets food quickly and understands the concept.  We walked in and took a seat at the long table near the bar, where the incredibly friendly and kind general manager, Geoff, came over at  our invitation to talk about the concept.  Chefs were brought in from all over the country to compete for the opportunity to open a first restaurant in this space with full support of the creators/owners (former military) - a True food incubator in the ever-growing Pittsburgh tech scene!  The chefs stay for 18 months and then have the opportunity to move on to their own businesses. This format means that every single thing they do is great because each chef is so invested in putting his or her best food forward.  After we had a few drinks and some amazing local beers, we switched tables to one of the many in the back, where amazing art hung on the walls.  We walked up to the counters and placed our orders, were given a number for our table, and our food arrived. We ordered from each of the four restaurants and loved everything!  We plan to go back before the chefs change later this year - there are just so many great choices in this lively and fun spot!!  Thank you!!!  Awesome idea!

_DI6_tM2Lk7Fn_bnBo84Aw.text: Ate here a few weeks ago and loved it! Great concept, lots of variety to please everyone and delicious food! Looking forward to returning!

DBUHO2pZlCwJao3AUP64jQ.text: I hate to write this review, because I love the idea of Smallman Galley. But there is no way to give immediate feedback to the restaurants, so how do they know if they are actually doing a good job. Get some feedback cards on the table, it would be a great part of the "trial launch" concept. Then, I don't have to out you here in public. Carota Cafe's "Chicken Hash - sweet potato, fingerlings, leek, sage, pulled chicken, soft poached egg" was a mess. Yes, it'a a hash, but the sweet potatoes were soft like butter while the fingerlings were cooked perfectly. Nothing was crusted, just seemed re-heated. No sage flavor, the whole hash seemed premixed and the parts were indistinguishable. Finally the entire dish - including the lovely poached egg - was topped with a LOT of red pepper flake. Why? Nothing about spicy was on the menu, and if there was sage, it was overwhelmed by the red pepper. I'm OK with some heat, but not with my coffee! On the plus side - the chocolate babka was excellent and the morning bowl perfect for our super health conscious friend.

YFOrDgNHvzlYCA6d5EH-zw.text: Was so excited when this place opened up, great concept and food! Slightly on the pricier side but well worth it. My only complaint would be for the chefs to use local products such as spices & salts from Steel City Salt or fish from Penn Ave Fish Market and produce from Market Outlet which are all right around the corner...more local ingredients supporting the local vendors and shops.

3KlK7Kpy_vbGPItZrj97cA.text: Ate there today for lunch - what a great atmosphere and unique concept for a restaurant!  The food was fresh, creative and delicious and the beer selection was great.  Each of the four restaurants (chefs) are there for 18 months, after which time, they will move on to (hopefully) open their own place and four new chefs will replace them. We ordered dishes from three of the four restaurants, sat at the long table in the bar area and received a text when each dish was ready.  All of the beer served is brewed and bottled in Pittsburgh (except for Straub and Yuengling).  They even have an espresso bar where we picked up some lattes to go.  I would highly recommend this place and will definitely be back!!  A great addition to the Pittsburgh food scene.

aFDtX87vaHzeHmK3eMFKHQ.text: Great atmosphere and concept, along with excellent food. Our party of four ordered from two different places in addition to the bar. We were all happy with our food. Two of us got the Provision burger and agreed it was the best burger we've had in a long time. Loved the aioli with the fries. Also loved that water was on all of the tables, though we needed a refill. My dish was ready first, and I was almost done by the time the other three got their food (even though my friend ordered the same dish before me). This place is still getting its kinks out, so it can only get better!

ID-zObsoczA5jk-sv9RuWQ.text: Smallman Galley - it is all it is hyped up to be and more! The space itself is very open and there is plenty of space to sit with a large group or just the two of you. The food is delicious, my friend and I got dishes from Provision and Aubergine! We ordered the roasted squash (which was more a salad with the squash delicately spread on the plate with the salad and fixings on top) and the roasted olives from Provision, as well as the sundae for dessert (a perfect salty-sweet combination). And we got the fresh pasta and then chicken and dumplings dishes from Aubergine. The bar had wonderful selections for beer on tap, wine and creative cocktails. All in all, the wait was not long either. I love the concept of ordering and waiting to receive a text when your food was ready as well as being able to sit where ever you chose. So happy this 4 restaurant space opened up in the Strip District! Will be back soon!

BsyfO0t7RyquptrYsPGx8Q.text: Love this place! Such a cute Cozy vibe and it's something different than the usual place you go sit And have a waiter. The food is always diff and excellent

DtYms5obKKMAc2ksVx64sQ.text: I LOVE this place. We stopped for brunch (10am) on Saturday. I had the pork roast hash from Colonia and my husband had a steak dish (it was delicious - although he couldn't remember the name of it). Savory breakfast usually isn't my jam, but this was amazing. Mike came with roasted yams and an egg on top - perfection!  The coffee - oh man, the coffee! I had a pour over from Commonplace coffee and it was heavenly. So smooth and full bodied - a perfect compliment to my breakfast!  There is something for everyone on the brunch menu -  and Iron Born pizza? Yes please. I sampled their fare at a Yelp event a few months back - and normally I'm not a pizza for brunch person, but exceptions must be made. Their pizza is so crisp, flavorful and just all around amazing.  The atmosphere at the Galley is fantastic - I do recommend arriving early for brunch if you have a larger party. Seating is first come first serve - and there are high chairs, so families with young children aren't excluded. (We took our 5 month old - he enjoyed looking at the ceiling fans and the neat light fixtures!).  Whether it's morning, noon or night - stop by the Smallman Galley. They have something sure to appeal to everyone -oh, AND a bar .

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Bz11h2eZdqAX6wdjEHKn8g.text: What a fun place! Great concept of starter locations for small businesses. The major issue we had was deciding which place to buy from and what to get! The variety was amazing - and since Marty's has closed we were very pleased to see a nice breakfast / brunch spot available with seating options in the Strip!  The mimosas were lovely, although the bar staff was not as attentive as I (or many of the other patrons) would have liked.  All in all -- I'll definitely go back, mostly to see who's setting up shop and what delicious food they are offering!

9CXWjZw7iiXQfk4HmcCMiA.text: Ate here on Saturday when we were day drinking in the strip. It was the perfect stop for the 8 of us who all wanted something different. Hubs and I shared Pho, crab hushpuppies and the nashville hot chicken sandwich. Plenty for us to share. The coffee was the perfect pick me up to enable me to carry on. Fresh and delightful. The barista was a great help in choosing from the coffee selection. Had a Agave drink which I saw while perusing PA libations down the street. It was a wonderful stop and we are thinking of bringing out of towners from Columbus here on this Saturday!

9rDKynsskJr1N2wpTFBTqQ.text: This place is just the best idea. It's great for large groups because there is something for every palette, from burgers to Banh Mi. I love the number of seasonal vegetable options as well as the opportunity to try a variety of desserts from different chefs.  Be warned: this place is popular. It can be hard to find a seat during the popular dinner rush.  However, it's worth enduring a little chaos to try a variety of good food.

oUxH6QEBAsqwLjz3k2wtgg.text: Interesting concept and I liked the overall experience however the food itself from " Home" was absolutely terrible. I got the chicken and biscuits. It was dark meat fried chicken that had no seasoning and was luke warm and gummy. The biscuit was dry and the grits weren't great. I liked the fried egg and that's it. I might try other places here but this food was so bad it turned me off.

-rCSOMpmcNAIIwdDzF58CA.text: I really like the concept! I definitely love when I snag a appt at the bar during happy hour for good access! I really enjoy their wine selection and had the burger from home and it was delicious!

o6L8UNRAoxoZ_rNui8YPMQ.text: We liked this place though we were confused since it was our first time.  It's sort of like a stations type deal. Each place is its own business you pay there and they'll bring food to you or give your drink right away.   We ordered beer at the bar then walked over to the other side and got food from one of the vendors. We then found a seat back at the bar and our food was brought to us. We tried all specials and they were good though have changed since.   We want to go back and try another food vendor and get cocktails next time. The cocktails looked good though a bit expensive.

LWWEXIO07FxL8H1FbdF2Gg.text: I love this place. I love brunch here. I love dinner here. I love happy hour here. The variety of food options/restaurants paired with the casual atmosphere makes it an ideal place to meet friends, bring visitors, or go with coworkers. The pizza place is incredible, but I also love the chicken and waffles brunch option. There's a rotating large variety of beers on tap -some local options too- and the bartenders are always attentive. Only complaint is that they close very early on Sundays (3pm maybe?!).

kqJOS90w3G9IGw0hq2lvCg.text: Great place, crowded. I ate from the last place on the end. The fish sandwich was excellent. The fries were all crispy fried, to much for me. Then we had a drink, the sangria is sour grape fruit flavored. Good bartender.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smallman galley bar

zdy9Xuz4To47haQLkC4hXA.text: First off I must say hats off to the owners of Smallman Galley! What a genius concept for a restaurant! I've eaten at Smallman Galley twice now and totally love this place. The atmosphere & restaurant decor is spot on.  I ordered food from 3 of the different restaurants within Smallman Galley and I was completely pleased with everything I ordered. I can't really choose a favorite one because all their food is so different from each other.  But I will say I think my favorite dish is the cottage cheese toast from Toast.  Each restaurant had a very creative and unique menu. Their food presentation was done very well and thought out. Any one of these restaurants will do just fine with their own brick and mortar location.  With 4 different restaurants Smallman Galley will definitely have something for everybody. And excited to see what 4 new restaurants go in next.

wJ8oNrlnydWiX_sBp7wn3Q.text: Expensive. Easily spend $16-$20 a plate before drinks and tip same as going to a nice restaurant

iWiAIoI80M0XxDc60h45Bg.text: Do not miss!!! It's the most delicious well designed lunch spot ever! Pizza is phenomenal, the sandwiches and stuff from each place was unbelievably scrumptious !!!

65prr8909ZMRrIkwk6BRcw.text: Great place for a party. I love the idea of having many chefs with their own stations and menus.  A full bar gets you ready with that drink to find a table and plan your meal.  I will definitely go back.

IxPSSAYrtg-9ga1nRaySIg.text: I was really excited about when I first heard about the spot. Since then I have been there to eat about 10 times so I guess its one of my favorites. I end up there most often during brunch and really recommend it. You have to be in the mood to embrace the non-traditional style of it though. I have witnessed people arguing over table spots while embarrassed parents watch in horror. Try something new every time. Really cool bar menus.

q_CPX3uSYxr5TX_AQILiYw.text: Cute lunch spot with a choice for everyone.  Went for the Bahn Mi sandwich with the side of bone broth and it hit the spot just right!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HMauekHnQCLPQ7xsOipAAQ.text: A different concept that host 4 different kitchens. I had the wedding bowl with pork. So many different flavors.  Although it was a different concept with different types of food to try it would help I they had paper menus as well as written. There were water bottles on the table but I don't know who the last person was at my table so I got my water from the bar. Overall I'll be going back.

zl4gcJyeCO2LYHGN86ZwRA.text: Love this place! It was fun to choose what to eat as there are variety of choices.  Place was open and easy to find a table. Also it was convenient as the server delivered our food instead of picking up.

SEtedeOdbu5Coz9o0vmYUg.text: I was unfortunately disappointed by my experience at Smallman Galley. Don't get me wrong, I love the idea and enjoyed my food but my overall experience detracted from enjoying those things. The atmosphere was very overwhelming which made it unenjoyable and rather stressful - I would be interested to see if the experience on a weeknight would be different but nonetheless it detracted from my experience on Saturday night. There wasn't any clear direction on how everything worked other than watching other people and we awkwardly took our dishes up to the bussing station because no one had come by to clear the table. I think that the concept of the restaurant is great and I love the idea, but the execution was disappointing for me. In terms of the food, we had the Iron Born red pizza which was good but not life-changing. The quality of the food and speed at which it was brought out was great. Now that I've been there, I would like to try some of the other stalls but I won't be rushing to return soon.

4W09gOPjKhfPGRKW-48YYQ.text: Love the environment! A great place to eat with friends   Smallman is a fancier food court for adults. They serve a variety of foods and beers. You go to the different restaurant counters to order & then find a place to sit. The waiter will deliver the food to your table based on your order number.   I ordered a chicken sandwich from the restaurant closest to the bottom entrance (sorry, forgot the name of restaurant). The sandwich was the perfect amount of spicy. The chicken breast was juicy and came in a large portion.   Would recommend to any party who are finding a place to eat in Pittsburgh

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lPZyZ0kY6d9hm-2lTpY74A.text: It is a good concept restaurant with great decor. I went there Sunday Brunch, def going to be hard to find parking. However, it was easy to find table. The price for all vendors are on higher side.  I tried Chicken Taco Rice bowl from Baco Chicken was well marinated but a little dry. The rice was just plain white rice, not lime and cilantro as written on menu and it was dry.   Breakfast Burger was pretty decent and filling.   Overall unlikely for me to go back. It was a big disappointment for me since all my friends all talked about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast Burgur
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rice bowl Taco

pJQchEfKJa2tNCME42mFBg.text: What a cool concept! We found out about Smallman Galley through an internet search for a new place to try. I came here with my husband and my mom last weekend.   The seating area is kind of like a cafeteria, there are plates and utensils at stations and you pick your own seat. All four restaurants are right next to each other, and directly across from them are the coffee shop and bar.   We read the menu at each place, and we settled on an appetizer of fried pretzel bites from Sultry to start. They were just the right amount of crispy, hot, and not too salty! Loved them. Loved the cheese sauce they came with too.   My mom and I decided to split the sausage Alfredo rigatoni from Mangiamo, and it was incredible. A huge portion that even her and I couldn't split (my husband finished it off!). The sauce was really creamy but not too thick. I was a little disappointed they omitted the mushrooms, but my mom was pleased because she doesn't like mushrooms and didn't want to pick around them! The sausage was delicious as well.   My husband had Not Your Grandmas's Tacos at Ba-co, which were Nashville hot chicken tacos. They were very tasty (I tried a couple of bites!), but he said he wishes you got a little bit more substance for the price tag. Each taco had one small chicken tender strip on it (one was half the size of the other). He said he also thinks it should've come with a side of rice or something similar.   We did order a cocktail from the bar, it was the featured charity one. Not much flavor other than the vodka (even though there were a number of other ingredients listed on the menu). The bartender was super nice and helpful!  Overall, we are super psyched to come back and maybe try brunch!

tiQ6JS1fRj_WtNSpNA8d5g.text: Enjoyed our stop at Smallman Galley! Ordered our food from Home.  Parking: Pretty easy for a late lunch on Friday Facilities: This is a cool spot! Essentially they allow those interested in getting into the restaurant business to try out their menu and avoid some of the overhead costs associated with running a traditional brick and mortar. Service: Great! Food: Delicious! The burger was amazing and the chicken and biscuits were really good as well.  It's a really cool concept! We're excited to go back and try more of what they have to offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Burger
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and Biscuits

3HcqN9A4e5Ns-K4K163b9w.text: My friend and I came here for a late lunch! I got something at Baco which has many different tacos and sandwiches. I ordered the Pulled Pork grilled cheese with fresh cut fries. It was delicious honestly! The spices on the fries were unique, some kind of rub, sprinkled with cheese. The sandwich was great too! My friend got a flat bread at one of the neighboring restaurants and the flavor was good but it was surprisingly so small! We were both hoping Iron Born Pizza would be there, but they are not anymore.   The service was fine! It is a unique idea where you walk into a large room with multiple restaurants inside. You order from whichever one and seat yourself. Then, they bring your meal over! I am definitely coming back and trying something else next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. From Baco Taco. Pulled Pork grilled cheese sandwich with their fresh cut fries!

hopUJRiWRAcOCN3OosYkrw.text: This place has a cool concept! There are about 4 different restaurants in one! You order your food and then they deliver it to you! There is also a bar and a coffee bar. I have been here a few times but I recently had the Brunch Burger from Home and it was delicious! We also tried the brunch fries which were amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch Burger

UoGZmekbqHjyqk6SIiMHGw.text: Smallman Galley was a neat experience.  I was initially confused when certain 'restaurants' came up in searches around the area that I did not understand were one and the same with "Smallman Galley," but it makes enough sense once you know what it is.  Iron Born, Ba-Co, Banhmilicious, and Home are each their own 'stand' in the Galley and there is a separate bar.  Seating is communal for the most part with a couple very long table arrangements and some smaller tables around the edges.  Still water was set out at the tables with glasses, all other beverages need to be ordered at the bar, unless a specialty item specific to a stand, like Thai Tea from Banhmilicious.   The menus for each stand are limited because they are small kitchens, but if you want to have the variety of choice, having four different cuisine options under one roof gives the flexibility of a food court with the quality of a sit down restaurant.  I would say the menus are on the pricey side for what it is, but it is good quality if not a good 'value'.  I tried items off the brunch menu from Home.  The BLT was delicious and surprisingly filling. I also tried their home fries, perfectly cooked, but very glad I ordered the 'house sauce' on the side.  The potatoes were definitely enhanced by the flavor, but it is very spicy and might overwhelm some taste-buds, so it's nice to be able to control how much you have in each bite.  My boyfriend had Thai Tea and the Avocado & Honey Banh Mi off the brunch menu from Banhmilicious.  He readily enjoyed them both :)   We had no trouble getting seating on a rainy Sunday around 1 pm, but I could see this being a real gamble on weekend evenings if you are trying to seat more than 2 people together. With that in mind though, it should be a good experience for a group as well.

Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Home&#39;s brunch home fries, perfect!

MS4Cwb5fzyfyyZjoupDmiw.text: Food is very good with 4 rotating restaurants to choose from.  Ambiance is kind of like a fancy food court. I definitely didn't mind it since we had a large party. Parking might be hard to find but there are spots around.  The chefs are eager to please and are very informative. Definitely worth a try.

v1dFKWtQZF6-QNFSowo9XA.text: The restaurant was recommended to me by one of my great friends while exploring Pittsburgh. I truly enjoyed my time here. I can't say it's a hidden gem but certainly had the feel for it. The food was great. I had the Nashville chicken sandwich along with some gator tots for the table & it was all I needed to get me started for some daytime drinking. I loved the presentation of the food.  It's a place worthy visiting more than once right in the downtown area of the city. Highly recommend!

yyUsw0RhQr2KQAskHe6Dbw.text: A cool collection of food stands with a lot of really interesting menus.  I ordered from a couple of them and the food was solid, though not amazing...  There are several most menu items that I want to explore across the different options...so I'm sure to be back on future trips.  Everyone was very friendly.  The bar is also solid.

GjTO3Ml14beh_V2YEMe2Eg.text: I love everything about Smallman Galley! There are so many wonderful food choices and everything is fantastic. The worst part about coming here is deciding what place to go to! I have been to the Vietnamese place and also Home, which is American cuisine and both were amazing. I am eager to try the pizza and the tacos, but like I said, it's so difficult to decide what to try next!! I wish Pittsburgh had more of these food court style places, because I am in love!!

Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled pork eggs Benedict
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from the bar

ISWOqcn4a_vDIWRKfXAI3A.text: Came here recently for the first time with 2 friends.  The concept of numerous smaller restaurants within one big location was really appealing to all of us.  First of all, we loved that we could all try something different and didn't have to think of a type of food that we were all in the mood for. I tried the Smoked Salmon Poke at Bahnmilicious and it was amazing! The portion size was very generous and the various flavors/ingredients blended together perfectly. The food came out super fast as well.  One thing I am not a fan of is that it can be hard to get a seat. We came on a Thursday evening at 7pm and a lot of the dining seats were full as the tables are set up communal style seat yourself. We ended up sitting in the bar area and it does tend to get loud in there. Drinks ended up being on the pricier side as well (i.e. my cocktail was $12). Other than that, great place to check out. Can't wait to try brunch next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked salmon poke
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken poke

OzFhpyvVBqGV3LDsF0FJcg.text: I have been a regular customer of Smallman Galley for the past 3 years. I have always given very good reviews to Smallman and Federal Galley. I have paid extra to attend special events promoting the incubator chefs. I have spoken personally to incubator chefs providing personal, private criticism. I have always tipped the bartenders very well.    Tonight I was treated extremely rudely by both the bartender and the bar back. In the past, this particular bartender has brushed me off rudely when I have tried to place an order at an extremely busy bar. I am a 5'1" tall woman so it is normal that I am overlooked at a busy bar so I hold my glass above my head to be seen. This bartender has routinely told me to wait my turn as if I am somehow being rude by trying to be seen. A simple, "I see you" would be fine.   Tonight, I told the bar back I would like another beer. She rudely said that was not her job, the bartender would wait on me. She never passed my request on to the bartender that I could tell from my place sitting at the bar. My friend asked after 10-15 minutes if I had received my beer and I rudely commented that the bar back (expletive deleted) had not passed my request on to the bartender. I was promptly instructed to leave and that I would not be welcome back. Fine with me. I was not drunk. I had ridden my bike there, had two beers and dinner. No problem in not returning. I think the problem may be that these millennials don't realize that I am a very short woman accustomed to being overlooked so I have learned to compensate. I'm 60 years old. I was with two friends in their 70's who were appalled at how I was treated. I'm done with Smallman Galley.  By the way, only 18 of my over 500 reviews are one star.

okl25GaXHFl7WxU_OPsCXA.text: My wife and I really like going here and getting food from a couple places and sharing! Cool vibe and lotsa painless having a great evening eating good food made by top notch local businesses!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oNFoqMGOkO_rteDCfL9RDg.text: I love the concept of Smallman Galley. My boyfriend and I ate there for dinner on a Friday evening after a walk through the Strip District. There were many great options, so it was tough to choose. We wound up going with Home's Quack n Cheese (mac n cheese with duck in it!) and Bahnmilicious's tuna poke, which had some truffle oil.   My feedback to these chefs:   The Quack n Cheese was beautifully presented and the first few bites were heavenly; however, after the third bite, it started to taste very over salted and as a whole the dish was too rich to eat very much of. I would say to use much less salt and to find a way for the dish to be lighter.  The tuna poke was pretty good, though nothing too innovative. Coming from Washington DC, I have had fast-casual poke that was far better and more interesting than this dish. There are other toppings that would be brought into the mix to make it better. It might be useful for this potential restauranteur to try out the mitsubi concept there - this is Hawaiian street food, lightly fried chunks of rice with a sheet of nori and other fun topics (e.g. spam). This is more unique and looks great pictures (which can be important when trying to get your craft out there on social media!).  Overall, the concept was fun. We just were not blown away by the dishes we happened to pick. I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Quack n cheese&#34;
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna poke

T3FMnj5m27Mkg96Xf6XO1g.text: There are changes in the Galley again and I'm on top of them. Smallman Galley continues to excel with their chefs in training with 4 concept restaurants. While Home, Banhmilicious, and Iron Born are still there this review will focus on the "pop up" concept known as Crumb. For more information on the other 3 please refer to my previous reviews.  Crumb is the Galley's first all vegan restaurant. It is run by Chef Abigail who founded the vegan donut. She is also from Relish. I had the opportunity to interview her and learned that she will only be there for one month. She has no idea where her business will go afterwards.  The menu hosts interesting vegan concepts such as shrimp po boy and vegan donut ice cream sandwiches. The jackfruit burger is one of her specialties if you like that type of melon.  I decided to go with their garden burger and side salad. You can opt for vegan fries if you don't want the salad.  The ordering remains the same. Pay then you are given a number to take and you can sit anywhere. I sat down in the wide open area facing Smallman St and noticed that they have now put a small bar off to the back of this area. Their main bar and coffeeshop is still on 21st St entrance side.  I was truly amazed at the size of my sandwich and salad! Topped with everything you'd expect in a burger it was served on a baguette and was so good! A bit messy too! But they have plenty of napkins and utensils nearby so you can help yourself. Thinking I would be full from the lunch I wanted to try the ice cream sandwich donut but learned she wouldn't be getting them in until later this pm. I settled for a regular one instead.   Again the donut was very good and not as filling as I would expect. I really enjoyed it. Crumb is anything but crumbs considering with the generous portions you get with a meal.   A vegan concept is wonderful to have in the Galley and is a welcome addition to a city that doesn't have a lot of all vegan restaurants. Whether you are vegan or not it is truly worth the experience.   Crumb occupies the space formerly held by Joey's snack bar. In Jan 2019 Crumb will be replaced with Ba-Co a street taco concept with a barbecue twist. It will be run by chef Tim D. with a more upscale type menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crumb menu
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan donut. Next time will get the vegan ice cream filled one.
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garden burger and salad

f-xZHd8K3rMEvQJ1hXrnIg.text: This is the coolest food spot in Pittsburgh. Four eateries and a common place coffee means you'll surely find something intriguing to eat, and will be able to get some great coffee if you are a coffee drinker. I had some great tacos and a delicious dessert. Definitely a place to which I will return.

Dv35CKCeXdBvyzmzPQX3yg.text: I've gone here twice and had a great time both times! Is pretty exciting looking at the different menus and all the food I've tried has been pretty good.   Today I got the Brunch Pie from Iron Born Pizza and tres leche cake from Ba-co. The pizza dough was super soft and puffy, and the bottoms/edges were really nice and crisp. It was a bit sweeter than I expected but I loved the runny egg and the gravy! It's also a lot of pizza; I took home half in a to go box.   Also great tres leche cake-good flavor, and I liked the whipped cream and dulce de leche on the side. For $8 I wish there was a bit more, but such is going to places like this I guess. From trying my friends dessert, Ba-co's hot chocolate isn't bad but it's not as good as the tres leche cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch pie
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tres leche cake

cxwlWc7veWGKNGoxq4P-4w.text: I've been to Federal Galley a handful of times so I was super excited to finally give Smallman Galley a try. Before arriving I was pretty set on getting Iron Born but decided to try something different since I always get the Detroit style pizza at Federal Galley.  I ended up getting Pho from Banhmiliciois. It was definitely a lot spicier than I anticipated and I eat plenty of spicy foods. I definitely wouldn't recommend it to those who can't handle spice. Other than that I think the soup was full of flavor and it was a very generous portion.   The only reason I can't bump this place up for a 4 star is because of the overall setup. There just isn't enough seating and it feels so tight. I felt like people were bumping me constantly as they walked by. I wish it were a little bigger and more open.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Al1fp2MGaSzSeN9G9Xr20Q.text: **Disclaimer: This review would be more of a 3.5 stars.  I came here with a large group for a friend's birthday dinner. I think the best way to describe this experience was "cafeteria style." We claimed our tables, and went off on our own exploring the different types of food offered here. I ended up going with Iron Born - a pizza place.  We reconvened at our adult cafeteria tables and tasted our Yinzer pie & Lovers pie. The taste was alright, although I'm not super picky with pizza so this just tasted like a fancier high-end pizza to me. I liked that there were unique options you probably can't get at your local Domino's or Papa John's, but it was very pricey (~$17 for one personal pie) for the size & ingredients. It was mostly a lot of bread with a thin layer of toppings & sauce.   However, I don't want to give this place only 3 stars because my friends seemed to enjoy the food from other stands and the atmosphere was lively. It may be hard to find seating, but if our group of 15 people can do it, I believe you can too!   Come for a nice, unique experience to sharing food "family style" in the Strip District. But don't set your expectations toooo high.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yinzer pie (top) &amp; Lovers pie (bottom) [Iron Born]

jnkHsHQmoHQP4D8Nm39WjA.text: If I want to eat at communal tables, serve myself and pay a lot for it, not to mention bus some else's crap off said table so I can sit down I will be happy to go here. Otherwise forget it! A millennials paradise...

rynxvMBTcYnZ2230I4E9tg.text: This is the best restaurant in town. There are so many choices and different styles of food that you can choose from. I highly recommend getting the hand made pasta. I love that it is a non-profit organization.

OwvQz0dpXoJS-VbwcYNngQ.text: Best Happy Hour in the city. Kat the bartender is the shiiiiiiiit. Also get the Provision fries. I love their stupid cocktail menu themes and great cocktails. And beer selection.

BbvX9KtPqDDJYhd-QuOCxA.text: Went here for the Michigan game. Awesome food and fantastic vibe! Would definitely recommend this for both drinks and food. Would be wary of Aubergine Bistro - the gentleman working there is very rude and is more than willing to express it.

LMoP3l-1uE2hW7Ezh_awEw.text: We stopped in after a visit with family in Pittsburg. Concept is unique and that's what I liked about it! Food was tasty  I highly suggest stopping in!

kkPCLS8gSGDUP3x9drLzcA.text: Love, love, love this place! (I would prefer to give it 4.75 stars.) The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is because I think they need to employ food runners--most especially during their busiest times. It would speed up the process and allow for better flow at the counter. Otherwise--this place is amazing. Aubergine's chicken pot pie was delicious (my meal) and my husband loved his scallops. Great atmosphere, amazing concept and the bar is fantastic too! The place was hopping and I didn't see a disappointed face anywhere! Lots of unique and delicious food choices from 4 fantastic chefs. Love it--can't wait to go back!

MBfI_p0r6BF8wzuRNRdiSA.text: Brew year's eve was a disappointment.  We spent $90 and got total 3 beers. Disorganization made access to the beer essentially impossible.  Needed crowd control and muliple stations set up.  No light snacks provided and restaurants stopped cooking at 10 pm on New Year's Eve.  They knew how many tickets were sold, but didn't have a way to provide everyone with expected samples of beer.  Will try the food at a less crazy time.

q5Dg4L1sIAd8oMKcsaEbFQ.text: Interesting concept! 4 unique and different chef styles in one restaurant.  We had beef chuck and wine, chicken pot pie and rancheros from the Aubergine Cafe, golden milk tea from the Carota Cafe and apple and almond upside-down cake from Josephine's toast. They were all delicious :-)

if2fvvyInr3SMCwSOOh-pw.text: Had the best dish I ate all summer last night at Carota Cafe - summer beans with heirloom cherry tomatoes, walnuts, shallots and a nice vinaigrette - tasted like everything had just been picked!  Great price point and a neat, communal table environment.

6cKoAnHJmd6CP6f8ytBdyQ.text: Wow! Who new you could get good food outside of Brooklyn.  Turns out there is a place and it's in Pittsburgh. Never mind waiting in line for Pamela's P&G Diner go to Small Man Gallery. Food options are fire. Enjoy!!

MB5B70BYA-_2252LIE0IKg.text: Love Smallman Galley.  It is an incubator for new chefs who would like to launch restaurants.  You can get really creative, fresh, local dishes for a fraction of the cost of a high end restaurant with the same quality food.  The atmosphere is fun and light.  We have been here several times and will keep going back.

ftdilQ-CPF5RNftjEsgAtA.text: I love this place.  It is especially great if you go with a group with a variety of food interests.  Everyone can be happy at one time!

eFm27BFr9-33GTwe_CLKug.text: Such a cool concept! My group had delicious food from all pop-up restaurants and great happy hour specials at the bar. I had the most delicious dessert I've ever had from Carota Cafe- a Maple Pot de Creme with sea salt caramel, fresh whipped cream, and oatmeal chocolate chip cookie crumble...amazing!

400GQ98oQNPwaKtDx-PmaQ.text: The fresh pasta from aubergine was the business. So was the creamed kale. So so tasty!

Gc6WcvqPSu1G6DYR3sD5bQ.text: A fun night out--and everyone can pick their own entree from one of four kitchens. My only complaint is sometimes the menu and chalkboards don't describe the dishes well and it's hard to get answers when its busy.

uRDb6Fq-X1ZGs03atmyQ6w.text: Super innovative way to overcome the issues of the food truck industry. The space has a gastropub vibe and a large room dedicated to sit down dining as well as another room for community tables and a large antique bar. There are four chef stations allowing you to choose dishes from a variety of artfully crafted dishes without leaving the single enclosed establishment. Simply leave your name and number with the chef station and they will text you when your food is ready. The bar has craft cocktails created by each chef to match their individual dishes. Bit of expert advice, although its an exciting concept don't feel obligated to try everything. Some stuff is more palatable and other is just too adventurous for everyone. Thats ok! Find one thing you like it's not tapas dining! The best part is the entire place works as an incubator so the better a single chef does within the 8 weeks they set up shop the more likely they are to get help from the organization to start a restaurant. WELCOME TO FOODIE HEAVIN.  I can't wait to see how this impacts the community. Go out and support, home townies, out of townies, doesn't matter! Just go!

TwGQKsE1rlR22Yf_LIj6PQ.text: Have been several times.  Loved everything, every time.  Great casual atmosphere.  Very friendly service.  Great place to have a sit down meal in the strip

NTLIxb8ihl88mOZGY5ZmYw.text: At Carota Cafe, I had the Spinach Scramble. It was one of the best breakfast's I've ever. Such outstanding sophisticated flavors lifted my spirits, especially the potatoes. And very reasonably priced for the quality of the food. I highly recommend it.

x0yipj35IKUV9EwVgNckpg.text: Love the concept! Have only tried the aubergine. I got the ricotta tart. My friends got pork belly and trout. They are pretty good, especially the pork belly.

9EYXrKkbXJ4l7qrfxnuqsw.text: Really loved all the food we got here, its a fun alternative to usual dining. The only thing to be ready for is that if your group orders from multiple places, the food may come out at different times. It is a place you have to be flexible but its worth it!

siylx1LBWPeWGNEC-RyRUA.text: The atmosphere is awesome. Drinks at the bar, pizza at iron born and coffee at Common Place. You must check it out. In my opinion, not a good spot for kids under 10.

u8-Op9THMJJie09HgmmwBA.text: This review is for Colonia. I had the skirt steak with chimichurri. It was the perfect combination of charring, spice and caramelization.  Had a few bites from the other plates in the group.  Needless to say, I have to go back to try the other restaurants. This place is a must go.

sPK1dOiKcBIN7PgeHnkIFA.text: First visit to Smallman Galley and love the concept. Easy to order and community seating with bottled water ready at each table made lunch time no nonsense for a weekday.  My open faced tuna at Josephine's Toast was delicious!  Expected some form of sandwich and pleasantly surprised with grilled bread topped with flavorful tuna salad. Tuna was lightly tossed with oil, arugula, thinly sliced radishes and olives. It was a visual as well as savory pleasure.  Looking forward to next visit.

EJCCk9k2e_u33Deg2aKsbQ.text: What a great concept!  I came here for brunch with my husband and a couple friends from out of town.  We got here around 1030 on Sunday and they weren't too busy at all.  We tried food from all four of the vendors, and everything we ate was great.  Wonderful attention to detail, and chefs who are happy to talk to you about their food.  We'll definitely be back!

HBiLSDTHMFRHdPa9vdFiwQ.text: I was so excited to try this out after multiple friends had said they loved the concept. I may have gone at an off time, but my experience was nothing special. I looked at all four stations and settled on the second station. I ordered from that and decided to give the first station a try. That guy was distracted by holding his baby and never even acknowledged me after standing there a while. And no offense, I am a mother who struggled through the 'balancing family and work' years. I decided I would come back and try something for dessert. When I went back the guy was really pre-occupied with whatever he was doing (looking through containers general kitchen stuff.). I felt I was making enough of a presence but after standing around for a while I just decided to leave. Maybe I shouldn't expect the chefs to have great customer service skills, but in honesty this did affect how I viewed my overall experience. I may give it another shot at a different time of day since what I did order from station two was delicious, and one of those meals you have to pause between each bite because the flavor is just that enjoyable.

WfVHmRC1tzskr6skTR00Zw.text: I totally understand the appeal of this place! Great idea of featuring up and coming venues with a variety of menu options. Have visited a couple times and have yet to be disappointed. Finding a seat can be difficult, but the wait is worth it!

KR25drrVUTKAh5BWJJESxg.text: Love the concept!  Great atmosphere and good selection of craft beer but the food was served ICE COLD!  Our restaurant choice was Josephine's Toast.

xr71mxVgHzt2Rm2_12qf1A.text: Went here for the first time over the weekend after dying to check it out for months and overall had a really great experience. I love the concept - you're free to wander around, grab a drink, order in stages, move tables, etc. The space is gorgeous and everybody we spoke to was super knowledgeable about the food or drink they were preparing, which was awesome. The place was the perfect amount of busy (Friday before a long weekend probably meant it was a little emptier than normal) and all of our food was ready ~10 minutes after we ordered it.  There were four of us and without planning we all ordered something different - more to try! Tip: Definitely check out the menus online before you go - some of the chalkboards were hard to read, and seeing all of the delicious-sounding options was almost overwhelming.  Smothered Fries - Provision PGH - At first I skeptical because the ingredients sounded really weird together: lentils? peas? goat cheese? Um ok....except together it was all AMAZING. These were the most perfect, crispy fries I have ever eaten, and the toppings all magically worked. I wouldn't necessarily order these for myself, but they're perfect to share.  Pork Belly, Shrimp+Grits, Pickles - Aubergine Bistro - There was a fried softshell crab special that looked amazing but it was sold out by the time we went to order. Boo. The pork belly was beyond succulent and flavorful. The shrimp and grits were OK (the grits definitely carried the dish), but the presentation was kind of underwhelming since they were just slopped into this tiny bowl with no garnish. The pickles were a tad too salty for me but they were a nice contract to the rest of the heavier dishes.  Octopus, Horseradish Gnocchi - Carota Cafe - Far and away my favorite. The octopus was tender and charred perfectly, and even swayed the seafood hater at our table! The potatoes and chimichurri were a little over-salted, but it didn't detract overall from the dish (more of a personal preference). I wish the gnocchi had been even heavier on the horseradish, but again, another personal preference. And the presentation blew everybody else out of the water - I wish I could have captured it in photos, but there were edible flowers!  At this point we were stuffed but realized we hadn't ordered anything from Josephine's Toast. TBH most of the dishes there seemed kind of underwhelming, but her dessert menu seemed on point so we gave the strawberry-rhubarb "cake toast" a shot. My expectations were low (I'm not usually a sweets person) but this was the perfect way to end the dinner - light, not too sugary, and perfect to share.  The only drawbacks from our experience and the reason I'm not giving 5 stars: 1. The drinks are REALLY expensive for what they are. I get that they're using local liquor and top-shelf brands, but $10-12 a cocktail (or glass of wine) adds up quickly. The bartender did mention they have a good happy hour special, unfortunately I'm never around the area during that time.  2. While the space doesn't have traditional servers, they did have two busboys on duty and honestly could have used at least one more. Tables nearby were left piled with dirty dishes throughout our entire meal, and we also had trouble flagging somebody down to refill our water bottle (we stole another from a nearby table but that didn't seem like a reasonable solution). Stuff happens and for all I know maybe they were short-staffed that night, but this was the one aspect of the night that left me kind of going "hmmmm." Reading other reviews it seems like it's an ongoing problem - it was relatively slow the night we were there, so I can't imagine what it must be like when it's busy.  Overall a really fun and interesting night out, and remarkably relaxing considering it was a lot of restaurant DIY. There were dishes at each place I can't wait to go back and try....not to mention brunch!

s4mVX4AyTHei7Fii8QsXRg.text: Nice food. Idiotic concept. You feel like you're walking around inside a website. Confusing. Line up and spend 6 dollars here, do it all again 3 feet away, have your privacy invaded and your data mined, get 4 texts and two robot calls, all to gather up your own lunch and sit at a picnic table. Guess what, Google-eyed hipsters, there are chefs out there who will wow you and treat you like a guest in their homes. Support them! Love innovation, but the Burgh is all about keeping it real, and this place is the polar opposite.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Miss the &#34;start page&#34; and you&#39;ll wander around cluelessly.

ziWBanskmIGVGAkHj44gjw.text: I've been to Smallman Galley about a half a dozen times and the food has been excellent every time. My biggest complaint is the set up and the confusion around ordering. Obviously, but the sixth time I was a pro, but you can see many people wandering around not quite getting the concept and no one there to direct or explain it to them. I'd highly recommend going.

QnC4cRNGyuf6dkLaJgsYXw.text: I was intrigued when I first heard the concept of this place. For those who don't know, this joint is a cooking experiment of sorts for new or not-as-well-known chefs to get a place to advertise their restaurant concepts with 18-month stints. As such, I decided to go one day and try this place. Currently, there are four restaurants nested within this place: Aubergine Bistro (mixed cuisines), Carota Cafe (veggies-inspired), Josephine's Toast (breakfast-based), and Provision Pgh Food + Drink (meat + global-inspired cuisine). If you're interested in learning more about what each place is about and what their menu lineup is, I suggest you Google Smallman Galley and see what this place is all about. In terms of how it works, just like going to any other restaurant. You pick a certain one (or however many you like to try), order and pay at the register. The eating area is cafeteria-style that is located in the back past the four restaurant concepts. If you're eating in, I believe they bring your food to you when it's ready. In general, you can't really go wrong with any of these places and it's a great way to support those who are up and coming in the food scene. Go check this place out!

0PY7ylMKF93x7RzQ7Qz5Rg.text: This is a very cool place. Awesome  and truly innovative concept, great vibe, and perfect for the most particular of eaters.

1h5naU9OgJ3iur29EHOKdg.text: Love the concept of a restaurant incubator, with 4 chef stations to choose from.. Went for Sunday brunch here.. As a vegetarian, I'm always restricted in terms of choice.. tried the Horseradish gnocchi based on other reviews, and it lived up to the expectations. Looking forward to trying it for dinner soon!

_A73COx9VR50lpLK1GNCYA.text: Great place. Great happy hour. God forbid you order drinks five minutes before 7 and the bartender rings you out at 7:01. Not a good way to get people to come back.

Ax7fprcTdxWpcR9dssDsFw.text: I like the concept - you can go there and take whatever you want. It is nice. However, the food is ok but nothing to write home about. For this price range, I would rather go to root 174 or legume.

-1FbGvBFXB1GjxbmeyLq7A.text: This is a wonderful concept and a great addition to the strip district. The gnocchi was fabulous.

2VSLWjMC2w5Q8k8gc7aI8Q.text: I have been here 3 times, always sharing plates with different people, and I have never had a bad dish.  The concept is interesting, reminiscent of Krog Street Market in Atlanta, on a smaller scale.  I most recently had the sweat and sour pork Banh Mi from Provision--yum!!  Though Provision changed up the traditional sandwich, I was not upset for the change.  It came with a generous salad.  I also have loved the squash grilled cheese from Provision's neighbor-also delicious.  People have loved the avocado toast.  Great place.

XQ_WQPsFIFqQ_HbJzE1C0Q.text: I love the concept and the food does not disappoint. I tried Provision and Carota Cafe. Both had great food, but my favorite thing that I tried was the gnocchi from Carota Cafe. I'm still thinking about it! I plan on going back for some more gnocchi before they change restaurants, but I'm looking forward to see what places move into the space.

HQYIh8fLxl6eoglBcsR02A.text: I went here for my bachelorette dinner. It was the perfect place, with lots of options for all. Not one person had a complaint about their food. In fact not one person did not rave about their food. It is a fun and safe way to take a bunch of people with lots of different taste presences while at the same time staying classy and fun. This place is what Pittsburgh needed!

SAtI7HDmC1XvgG3LxamK8w.text: I love this restaurant concept! There are so many different food options and all I've tried thus far have been amazing.  Highly recommend for a laid back night out.

mhhxX6-jwp3LaShyUzQH9w.text: Love the atmosphere in here! What a creative concept to have multiple restaurants within one and offer galley style seating. Clever!   I attended an event here in June to kick off Negroni week. The charity and calendar sales benefitted the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank. Drinks were refreshing. The food was eclectic and delicious! Servers were friendly and hospitable. I'll look forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheers!

_ZiA5u3II-hLO99khnor4A.text: Very cool place! First time here, will return. It is a group of small restaurants where the chefs can try out their creations. It is in an old warehouse with cafeteria style seating. Order at the counter and they deliver the food to your table. The downsides being you have to go to one place for your entree, another for your coffee, and a third for your Bloody Mary. And pay separately. The other thing is if you order from different places from your companions the food will come out at different times and you may find yourself drooling while they eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Making iron born pizza
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Colonia menu board
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Iron Born pizza menu board

vPGlaHWJFWZLemuoCKr92g.text: This is my first visit to Smallman Galley on a Friday around 4:30.  We tried the food from Aubergine.    I ordered the Pan Seared Spanish mackerel and the Egg Salad.  I liked how inexpensive Mackerel was.  Eating mainly fish, usually when I go out to eat it seems like I'm paying a premium.  Pricing wise it stood along with everything else on the menu.  The fish itself was very well portioned, cooked and seasoned just right: nice and crispy on the outside and just heavenly on the inside.  It was paired with Carolina rice and snap peas.  It reminded me of a dish you could get from a Puerto Rican neighborhood in New York.  The egg salad was really rich and super filling.  I'm also glad that they didn't overdo it with the anchovies.  So that made them a nice touch.  You definitely get a decent portion of egg salad so it's absolutely worth sharing.  We also were lucky enough to come during happy hour which only means one thing...half off drinks! The bar is this beautifully slated bronze and the bartenders and incredible: they really know their stuff and put their time and care into your drink by tasting the larger batch before pouring a glass.  I'm glad we came at the time that we did because the chef said he was expecting it to be incredibly busy tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked yams from Carota Cafe are to die for!  The flavors are diverse and intense, so prepare yourself.
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. He&#39;s the DJ, I&#39;m the Rapper: the Girliest Drink on the menu
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pan Seared Spanish Mackerel @ Aubergine

he4dF9HPyacofyzwaUO0pg.text: Omg so my girlfriend look this place up on yelp! She knows I love gastro pubs the FOOD! Here is F'n!!!! Amazing  there is like 5 restaurants in this place... so bring ur friends family or date here..  check this place out my yelpers

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tostitos with chicken a MUST ! have
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scallops with this amazing stuff lol
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This bar was poppin .. Great bartender she was awesome!

YqzDdQX2saJIE6UgT2Qnpw.text: Service was awful. A lead server/manager with blond hair, glasses and pigtails was so rude that we will never return and tell our friends to never go as well.

Y-R_m9x2LeR7jOJFrf0uXg.text: Great concept of an incubator for budding chefs.  I bring friends here when they are in town because this is something they probably won't find at home.  The food is solid, but I find it a bit pricy for the informal style.

_izkNU0ZGolS4kMQl7bB-w.text: To say I'm THRILLED about this places existence is an understatement. To see four different chefs testing out their planned business right in front of you is so exciting!  Not sure what I'm talking about? Well, these four chefs have 18 months to make it or break it. Once those 18 months are up, hopefully they will have built their biz enough so that they can have their own brick and mortar restaurant.  Honestly, I don't know how any of the four wouldn't have a great chance with the excellent food I've tried. And believe, I've tried them all!  Provision's gastro pub style burger and double fried fries are incredible. I love the vegetable forward vibe of Carota Cafe and will have dreams about their squash grilled cheese. Aubergine rocked my world with a fried rice dish and local maple glazed ham. Finally, Josephine's Toast is everything you want in bread, plus delicious additions, like mussels in a tasty broth you can dip your toast in!  Haven't convinced you already to head there? Well then belly up to the bar for an excellent array of cocktails (love the "to the five boroughs") and a great craft beer list.   It's cafeteria style and very large inside, so no need to worry about reservations or snagging a seat. Get yourself to here for a really unique experience and amazing food and drink to boot!

l-aVeU8pyME_7UAGzsvoog.text: Half off drinks during happy hour is SUCH A GOOD DEAL! They're always packed, the drinks are personalized and super specialty, which is why they're so yummy, and food is always good. Highly recommend!

qDXs8gfBFo8YNV-4UgMHVQ.text: Interesting concept you should try  This restaurant is really multiple pop-ups in the same space.  I would call it a restaurant incubator.  We went on a very cold Saturday night right before New Years Eve.  Because of that, we were fortunate not to have to stand in line, though I suspect on a typical Saturday night there is a bit of a line and open tables are hard to find.  There are four restaurants and two bars to choose from.  We had pizza from Iron Born Pizza and it was fantastic.  Deep dish pizza done right.  The flank steak from Colonia was excellent as was the braised lamb pasta from Brunoise.  I didn't really care for the soup from Brunoise (parsnip, chestnut, & orange) but others in our party enjoyed it.  The vegetarian in our group ordered the "divorce bowl" from Colonia which was a rice and beans bowl with other veggies and jalapenos.  It was also excellent.  My only complaint is that neither of the bars had any beer on tap that was  of a lighter, Belgium or American Pilsner style.   I get that bitter IPAs are all the rage, but not everyone likes their beer that way.  Fortunately, the bartender was able to hook me up with a delicious Canadian whiskey I had never tried so all was not lost.  I love this concept since it allows you to try many different options and can accommodate groups where not everyone wants the same style of food.

TbMteJDISkXw2yF95-ynBg.text: This place is remarkable.  Many options by folks that truly give a darn whether or not you are served a delicious meal.  While not for those looking to be waited on with traditional style, after one visit you will be waiting at your table for delivery of your food with too much salivation.   The Iron Born pizza, Detroit Style, is a personal favorite.  For folks from Pittsburgh it is the slice of pizza you never knew you loved devoutly.  I have been back a few times.  I am always a little surprised at the cost...until I begin to enjoy the circus of flavors in my mouth.  It IS worth it.  The concept is worth it.  The place is brilliant and evolving and a must for locals and visitor alike.  Generally, there are 4 or 5 different mini-restaurant options from Asian to Italian to Americana and beyond.  Go for it.  Your inner Strip District adventurer will thank you.

d5L0Pa7czTUtdBJsiqIX6w.text: This was our first time here and it was the week after the refresh with new chefs. We came for breakfast and there were plenty of spaces to sit.  My girlfriend got The Brazilian which was a medium steak with beans and stewed tomatoes. I got the Brazilian breakfast sandwich on cheese bread with an egg and ham. Everything was very good and very filling.  The coffee bar was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smallman Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

W9E63QhqnUj1v9KElypL-w.text: This place rocks, very unique as for Pittsburgh standards, has multiple restaurants in one place serving different varieties of food from Detroit style pizza to Baht Mi sandwiches. All the food I have had was very good and has a great atmosphere for either lunch or dinner. It is located right in the Strip District, which makes it great for Saturday Brunch and a little shopping.

rOUQyBgDjToOfsUrdQkK6A.text: This place had decent food but the wait was extremely long and service was terrible. You pay up front so there is absolutely no incentive for the staff to be helpful in any way. The wait staff seems to be either stoned or incompetent. Definitely not family friendly - it gets packed and there is hardly any seating. When we complained to the manager about how long we had been waiting, he tried to justify the bad service. Won't be back.

TeZ_P_3H7z3wXeQB0IXRew.text: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. In addition to an amazing concept, the food here is out of this world! I came here for an event and ended up ordering a full meal from Brunoise. Ho.ly. Cow. I've had a lot, and I mean A LOT, of cheeseburgers from across the country and Europe, and the burger from Brunoise was far and away the best burger I have EVER had. The burger itself was so juicy and flavorful! The bun was soft and fresh. The combo of the cheeses and other toppings just meshed so well together. I am salivating just writing this review!!! I also ordered the Smores dessert after seeing and hearing a lot of buzz surrounding it. It was fabulous! The chocolate was divine AND it had Millie's ice cream---I lean what else do you need, right? To top it all off, the chef was super nice! I'll happily go back again and again!!
